definition: to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)

sentences.english: Children of the rescue work continued, suddenly heard "help" the voice shouted.
sentences.chinese: 子弟们继续着救援工作，突然听到“救命”的呼喊声。

sentences.english: The shout goes up as a great shadow sweeps over our boat.
sentences.chinese: 伴随着喊声，一个巨大的影子扫过我们的船。

sentences.english: The movements are simple and the shouts vehement.
He bellows, rends the air with anguish.
sentences.chinese: 他咆哮着，痛苦的喊声划破长空。

sentences.english: Hearing the shouts, the lord walked out of the house unhurriedly in the end.
sentences.chinese: 听到了喊声，慢慢地最后出来的是主人。

sentences.english: Their shouts re-echoed through the valley.
sentences.chinese: 他们的喊声在山谷中回荡。

sentences.english: The hussars thronged about him and responded by a loud shout in unison.
sentences.chinese: 骠骑兵们都聚集起来，一齐用洪亮的喊声回报。

sentences.english: Here there is no city in the horn sound and noisy chants.
sentences.chinese: 这儿没有城市中的喇叭声和嘈杂的呐喊声。

sentences.english: The phone's tinny speakers blared the noise of shouting and a stream of gunfire.
sentences.chinese: 手机上小小的喇叭里，刺耳的喊声和枪声响成一片。

sentences.english: Wave upon wave of field cheerleading chants.
sentences.chinese: 场上啦啦队的呐喊声一浪高过一浪。

sentences.english: What he said was so foolish that they hooted him off the platform .
sentences.chinese: 他说的话太愚蠢了，他们用叫喊声把他赶下了台。

sentences.english: That was pre-school children cry of alarm sound.
sentences.chinese: 那是学前班的孩子们惊恐的哭喊声。

sentences.english: They wanted to howl me down, but I didn't take to heart.
sentences.chinese: 他们想用喊声把我轰下台，可我根本就不在乎。

sentences.english: The shouts resounded in our ears.
sentences.chinese: 呼喊声在我们的耳边回响。

sentences.english: We were woken (or wakened) in the early hours of the morning by the shouting of the mob.
sentences.chinese: 凌晨我们被那些闹事的群众的叫喊声吵醒了。

sentences.english: On the night of the day, I was aroused from sleep by the cry of fire.
sentences.chinese: 当天夜里，我在梦中被失火引发的叫喊声惊醒。

definition: yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
